title: Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition
notes: Not sure if DSFix is working. Replaced install of Dark Souls from Windows partition, that used DSFix. However, game works well.

title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die Edition
notes: DSfix doesn't work

title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die Edition
notes: Runs fine, 30fps locked which is normal, haven't tried with dsfix. Its a shame you can no longer buy this version as the remaster appears to not work with Proton, but I've seen it work with Wine/DXVK before so its probably down to a more specific version/configs etc.

title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die Edition
notes:
Game itself runs, DSFix does not. To make DSFix work, you have to override dinput8.dll for the games Wine-prefix. Open winecfg with env WINEPREFIX="[SteamLibrary]/steamapps/compatdata/211420/pfx" winecfg
and add library override for dinput8 (native, builtin).

title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die Edition
notes: You need to disable Steam Controller system to use a joystick.

title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die™ Edition
notes: when using proton 3.7-5 beta no longer has huge framerate drops when loading new areas, at most a small hickup if area loading is taxing. Apart from that is steady 30fps at all times (tested bottom of blighttown, entered from firelink and still maintained 30fps)
os: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die™ Edition

title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die™ Edition

notes: For dsfix work run "WINEPREFIX=~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/211420/pfx/ winecfg" and add "DINPUT8" to libraries. But still no sound and video on intro.
title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die™ Edition

notes: Install dinpu8 to use Dsfix,  i have pulseaudio issues, i have to set "tsched_buffer_size=0" to load-module module-udev-detect in etc/pulse/default.pa and PULSE_LATENCY_MSEC=30 %command% to the game launch option.
title: DARK SOULS™: Prepare To Die™ Edition

notes: Works fine and with DSfix.  Fullscreen might not work perfectly in my tiling WM, but a single keyboard shortcut fixes it.
